alert.note: Alert for Daviess (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 29 at 4:35PM EDT until June 29 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: The National Weather Service in Paducah has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Daviess County in northwestern Kentucky... * Until 700 PM CDT. * At 335 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated additional heavy rain from thunderstorms that will move back into the county from the north over the next 15 to 30 minutes. Rainfall rates of 0.75 to 1 inch within 20 minutes are possible. This additional rain will be falling on top of saturated soils from 2 to 4.5 inches of rain that occurred earlier. Flash flooding is expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Owensboro, Rockport, Whitesville, Masonville, Stanley, Knottsville, St. Joseph and Moseleyville. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
